conclusion: Analyze forces on pillow and child to relate to rope tension.
Identify forces on pillow: weight and tension.
Identify forces on child: weight, tension, and normal force.
Resolve forces on pillow into components parallel and perpendicular to plane.
Net force along plane for pillow: T sin(β) = m1 g sin(α).
Solve for T: T = (m1 g sin(α)) / sin(β).
Resolve forces on child into components.
Net force along plane for child: T sin(β) = m2 g sin(α).
Solve for T: T = (m2 g sin(α)) / sin(β).
Normal force on child: N = m2 g cos(α).
Calculate ratio of T to N: (tan(α)) / sin(β).
Final ratio of tension to force: (tan(α)) / sin(β).
